title: For Turo, It’s Ride or Die
sub_head: Like many tech companies, Turo had a hot minute last year amid the pandemic. Will it also crash and burn?
body:
Car-sharing marketplace Turo made its public offering filing public on Monday, inviting prospective investors to “take a look under the hood.” Is there sustained horsepower under all the smoke?
The first page of the S-1 is typically heavy on Silicon Valley narrative. With Turo, “guests can take the wheel of the perfect car for any occasion, while hosts can take the wheel of their futures,” the company says. The elevator pitch that Turo can be the Airbnb of car sharing might have merit, but the numbers show it isn’t there yet.
